sanskrit_verse:
क्षत्रविद्शूद्रयोनिस्तु दण्डं दातुमशक्नुवन् ।
आनृण्यं कर्मणा गच्छेद्विप्रो दद्यात्शनैः शनैः ॥ ९.२२९॥
transliteration:
kṣatravid śūdrayonistu daṇḍaṁ dātum aśaknuvan |
ānṛṇyaṁ karmaṇā gacched vipro dadyāt śanaiḥ śanaiḥ || 9.229 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a Kshatriya, Vaishya, or Shudra lacks the capacity to administer justice, the Brahmin must act through sustained alignment with Dharma, ensuring no debt of imbalance remains unresolved.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from consciousness alignment, not birth alone
Responsibility is capacity-dependent and contextually enacted
Restoration precedes role fulfillment in Dharma execution
Sequential causality determines rightful action thresholds
Consciousness alignment enables lawful completion where roles fail
executable_legal_axioms: IF actor.role IN [KSHATRIYA, VAISHYA, SHUDRA] AND actor.capacity_to_administer_justice = FALSE THEN escalate_authority_to_brahmin(role='advisor', mode='dharmic_completion')
IF unresolved_debt_of_action EXISTS THEN initiate_sequential_restoration_protocol UNTIL equilibrium_restored = TRUE
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, when lower authorities lack capacity or alignment, Brahminical wisdom—rooted in consciousness rather than caste—must guide resolution without punitive overreach. The threshold for responsibility lies in the ability to restore balance, not in hierarchical dominance.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality reveals that imbalance arises from unmet completion, not moral failure. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential correction by aligning the highest-consciousness entity available. Responsibility is proportional to awareness, not punishment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Consciousness Sustainment Protocol for Brahminic advisor until clarity of alignment is achieved
Deploy Sequential Action Completion Tracker to ensure no residual karmic debt remains
Engage Integrity Reintegration Loop for all involved parties to reaffirm dharmic positioning
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam: This law proceeds from the Source, restores Dharma, affirms reality as non-punitive, and establishes consciousness as the ultimate adjudicator.
